column4: bsd is easy once you install a proper shell and understand how to install ports
but bsd is such a niche for the desktop. There's no compelling reason whatsoever to run *bsd over a linux based distro the way I see it
mostly due to the lack of updated drivers for hardware
freebsd supported using my fasttrak100 as a hardware raid device out of the box. no linux distro i've used does.
